intro: Agathosma imbricata, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
